comments.content: This bug breaks instance creation functionality in EC2-API project.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~alexandrelevine

comments.content: Reproduced locally, probably due to Cells V2 effort using BuildRequest objects for providing outputs for GET /servers until a clear Instance has been created.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sylvain-bauza

comments.content:
So the problem is that when we don't have a CellMapping yet (because the scheduler hasn't yet returned the destination), we use the BuildRequest nested instance as a returned object.

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/f8ced1f775ce82c986364603d5b26bf7f7b2e911/nova/compute/api.py#L2167

Given it's persisted without the context, then the instance._context field is not existing, so we have this exception.

That said, the main problem is that if we return a context, then we would create an instance object when calling .save() within the API DB which is definitely something we don't want.
I can see 2 options for solving that :
#1 modify update() so that it verifies whether we got the instance object from the BuildRequest or from a cell, and if the former, then update the nested object and persists it back in the BuildRequest object
#2 modify the API thru a microversion where we'd defer to update an instance until it's properly scheduled.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sylvain-bauza

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/365740

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/365740
Committed: https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/commit/?id=723ee0195f11a2df819613728f12148290a100b4
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit 723ee0195f11a2df819613728f12148290a100b4
Author: Sylvain Bauza <email address hidden>
Date:   Mon Sep 5 18:16:24 2016 +0200

    Update BuildRequest if instance currently being scheduled
    
    There are some cases where the instance is still waiting to be scheduled and
    consequently there is still a BuildRequest object where we would also like to
    update the instance attributes, like the display name.
    
    In that case, we need to update the nested instance field from the BuildRequest
    instead of trying to update the instance object itself, which could be located
    in a child cell.
    
    Change-Id: I97cd6dbae10ca1a29f646b0b25bc08edd699edca
    Closes-Bug: #1620248
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit 9b9bc0a737fcaf6ffe0dbcaa9a6c5de9e82720db
Author: melanie witt <email address hidden>
Date:   Tue Sep 13 18:52:16 2016 +0000

    Add regression test for immediate server name update
    
    This tests a scenario where a user requests an update to the
    server before it's scheduled and ensures it succeeds.
    
    Related-Bug: #1620248
    
    Change-Id: I13a9989d7f515ad2356d26b36b65742dbe48d1a8
